I'm a graduate student studying data science and international development at Stanford. Previously I earned my MBA from the University of Chicago as an Edwardson Civic Scholar. I used to work in homeless services and more recently was a consulting data scientist in the World Bank Group's Department for Outcomes. I'm interested in using technology and statistics to make humanitarian and development assistance more effective.

## Projects
- **Outcomes Target Map** - Built organization-wide dashboard in R Shiny to help World Bank Group track development targets across country portfolios

- **[Illegal Mining Detection in Ghana](https://24-bee-supply.shinyapps.io/ashanti_region_galamsey_detection_dashboard/)** - Trained machine learning model on satellite imagery to identify informal mining sites; integrated licensing data and local governance information to map regulatory gaps

- **Computer Vision for Homeless Services** - Developing satellite image classification system to detect unsheltered homelessness in San Francisco using Planet.com imagery (in progress)

- **Renewable Energy Attitudes in Germany** - Harmonizing four decades of German survey data (1980-2021) to analyze hyperlocal attitudes toward renewable energy development, accounting for territorial reforms and administrative boundary changes (in progress)

- **Testing Modernization Theory with Asia Barometer** - Statistical analysis of survey data across eight Asian countries examining relationships between economic development and democratic attitudes (in progress)
